I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this issue. But, I'm having issue using  [System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface] in PowerShell Core under Windows 10 Insider Build 16294.
The good news is that it works in Windows OS with PowerShell Core and with the full Ubuntu Distro.
(See image below)

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Execute following command line:
```powershell
[System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface]::GetAllNetworkInterfaces()
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Should list the following similar results: (sample from Linux)
```
PS /home/maxt> [System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface]::GetAllNetworkInterfaces();                        

Id                   : lo
Name                 : lo
Description          : lo
OperationalStatus    : Unknown
Speed                : 
IsReceiveOnly        : 
SupportsMulticast    : False
NetworkInterfaceType : Loopback

Id                   : enp2s0
Name                 : enp2s0
Description          : enp2s0
OperationalStatus    : Up
Speed                : 100000000
IsReceiveOnly        : 
SupportsMulticast    : True
NetworkInterfaceType : Ethernet

```

Actual behavior
---------------
Exception error when executing command in Windows 10 Ubuntu
```
PS /home/maxt> [System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface]::GetAllNetworkInterfaces();                        Exception calling "GetAllNetworkInterfaces" with "0" argument(s): "An error was encountered while querying information
from the operating system."
At line:1 char:1
+ $a = [System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface]::GetAllNetworkI ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NetworkInformationException
```

Environment data
----------------
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16294
Platform                       Win32NT

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS /home/maxt> $PSVersionTable                                                                                          
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.7
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-43-Microsoft #1-Microsoft Wed Dec 31 14:42:53 PST 2014
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```
![win10ubuntu_netinfoerr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/30750573-d95c57d8-9f84-11e7-8c62-d16b710b4137.png)
